trial_identification.studytitle: A proof of concept, multi-centre evaluation of the potential beneficial effects of CB0011 when combined with CB0012 for the treatment of obstructive sleep apnea.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A proof of concept, multi-centre evaluation of the potential beneficial effects of CB0011 when combined with CB0012 for the treatment of obstructive sleep apnea.

interventions.interventions: A four week 2:2:1 randomised study in patients diagnosed with obstructive sleep apnea. 100 completed patients required with 40 to be randomised to CB0011 alone, 40 patients to be randomised to CB0011 and CB0012 and 20 patients randomised to placebo.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Changes in Obstructive Sleep Apnea as measured by the patient apnea hypopnea index score (AHI).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Parameters measured at baseline and week four (or early termination) by overnight polysomnography and between three and five nights per week by patients utilising an ambulatory home monitoring device.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Changes in Obstructive Sleep Apnea as measured by the respiratory disturbance index (RDI).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Parameters measured at baseline and week four (or early termination) by overnight polysomnography and between three and five nights per week by patients utilising an ambulatory home monitoring device.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Changes in Obstructive Sleep Apnea as measured by oxygen desaturation index (ODI).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Parameters measured at baseline and week four (or early termination) by overnight polysomnography and between three and five nights per week by patients utilising an ambulatory home monitoring device.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Changes in daytime sedation, quality of life, sleep quality, mood, fatigue and weight measured.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at baseline, week two, and week four or early termination.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Subjects must have a current diagnosis of Obstructive Sleep Apnea, have an apnea-hypopnea index (AHI) of between 10-40 (using a strict definition of hypopnea), with a calculated BMI equal or less than 34 at the time of study entry.

trial_design.sequence: Block allocation and customised computer sequence generation

contact.name: Associate Professor Ron Grunstein
